summary:
In pro wrestling, **kayfabe** means pretending the fights and stories are real. It's like when actors stay in character even when the cameras aren't rolling.

Back in the day, wrestlers had to keep kayfabe all the time, even in public. Now, with the internet and wrestling being more entertainment-focused, kayfabe is mostly just for shows. Sometimes, though, it gets broken, like when a wrestler gets hurt for real.
title: Kayfabe
